channel.title: Resource Notes on
channel.description: Recent content in Resource Notes on

item.title: Design Justice - Book
item.description: Information Source: [[Sasha Costanza-Chock]] Tags: #design #technology #innovation #nonfiction #society #education Notes: [[Literature Notes/Design Justice - Literature Notes]] Reboot Summary Design justice also focuses on the ==design of systems== Design justice rethinks design processes, centers people who are normally marginalized by design, and uses collaborative, creative practices to address the deepest challenges our communities face.

item.title: A Pig Was Once Killed in Our Garage - Book
item.description: Information Source: [[Martin Villanueva]] Tags: #essays Notes: [[A Pig Was Once Killed in Our Garage (Literature Notes)]] Highlights “What I write here is not my teaching, but my study; it is not a lesson for others, but for me.

item.title: 13 Principles of Web3 - Thread
item.description: Information Source: [[David Phelps]]; https://twitter.com/divine_economy/status/1454218925483384834 Tags: #web3 Notes: Highlights Web 3 can transform everyday instutions. Each reveals a fundamental principle of what Web3 means.

item.title: A Digtial Yggdrasil - Education as a Public Good - Proposal
item.description: Information Source: [[Qing Ze]] Tags: #web3 #education #publicgoods Notes: Highlights Web3’s Shared Challenge: Growing Our Own Timber We need to develop a system that onboards people to Web3 in meaningful ways enabling them to contribute as their best selves while forging their own narratives.

item.title: Are We Human - Resource Notes
item.description: Information Source: [[Beatriz Colomina]]; [[Mark Wigley]] Tags: #design #archaeology Notes: Highlights Introduction The question are we human? is from the beginning a hesitation about the relationship between ourselves and everything around or inside us.

item.title: Becoming - Book
item.description: Information Source: [[Michelle Obama]] Tags: #memoir Notes: [[Literature Notes/Becoming - Literature Notes]] Highlights Now I think it’s one of the most useless questions an adult can ask a child—What do you want to be when you grow up?

item.title: Breaking Smart - Newsletter
item.description: Information Source: [[Venkatesh Rao]] Tags: #technology #future Notes: [[Literature Notes/Breaking Smart - Literature Notes]] Highlights Against Waldenponding 1 https://breakingsmart.

item.title: Capitalism in virtual worlds - Essay
item.description: Reference Source: Keywords: [[Permanent Notes/permanent notes]] Relevant Notes: #metaverse #games #web3 #capitalism Notes I quickly realized how much extra features the premium members got that I didn’t get.

item.title: Check Your Pulse (Newsletter)
item.description: Information Source: [[Sari Azout]] Tags: #technology #venturecapital #innovation Notes: [[Literature Notes/Check Your Pulse - Literature Notes]]

item.title: Computers and Creativity - Thesis
item.description: Information Source: [[Molly Mielke]]; https://www.mollymielke.com/cc#mold Tags: #creativity #innovation #technology Notes: Highlights to foster optimal human innovation, digital creative tools need to be interoperable, moldable, efficient, and community-driven.

item.title: Content, Services, and Asset Businesses in the Metaverse - Essay
item.description: Information Source: [[Matthew Ball]]; https://www.matthewball.vc/all/csametaverse Tags: #metaverse #content #business Notes: Highlights The Metaverse will also revolutionize categories which, for the most part, have ==avoided disruption throughout the internet era.

item.title: Deschooling Society - Book
item.description: Information Source: [[Ivan Illich]] Tags: #education Notes: Highlights Two illusions of the school system Packaging instruction with certification; linking instruction (not learning) to role assignment Most learning is the result of teaching

item.title: Do Design - Book
item.description: Information Source: [[Alan Moore]] Tags: #nonfiction #design #philosophy Notes: [[Literature Notes/Do Design - Literature Notes]] Highlights salve corpus amanti, literally translated as ‘save the lover’s body’.

item.title: Evergreen notes turn ideas into objects that you can manipulate
item.description: Information Source: [[Stephen Ango]] Tags: #writing #notetaking Notes: Article Highlights Evergreen notes that stood out to me…

item.title: Fakepixels - Newsletter
item.description: Information Source: [[Tina He]] Tags: #creativity #technology #innovation #philosophy Notes: [[Literature Notes/Fakepixels - Literature Notes]] Highlights Vol. 58: Dance me to the end of love ==Cathachresis:== a statement is so astonishingly wrong that it feels right.

item.title: Fortnite and Minecraft are getting kids excited about learning again - Essay
item.description: Information Source: [[Greg Toppo]]; ‘Fortnite’ and ‘Minecraft’ are getting kids excited about learning again Tags: #games #education Notes: Highlights “==I like to say we’re giving kids the tools that they need to lead successful lives in the digital age—and preparing them for the coming of the metaverse==,” said Ed Fleming, founder of a long-running computer camp based in Philadelphia.

item.title: Gamification vs Pointsification - Essay
item.description: Information Source: [[Ana Lorena Fabrega]]; https://afabrega.com/my-blog/gamification-vs-pointsification Tags: #games #education Notes: Highlights Pointsification ties to ==external motivation==—free time, tasty treats or bragging rights.

item.title: Garden City - Book
item.description: Information Source: [[John Mark Comer]] Tags: #nonfiction #Christianity #religion Notes: [[Literature Notes/Garden City - Literature Notes]] Highlights Because when we stop working, we lose a part of who we are.

item.title: Half-Baked Futures - Newsletter
item.description: Information Source: [[Jasmine Sun]] Tags: #technology #sociology #social Notes: [[Literature Notes/Half-Baked Futures - Literature Notes]]

item.title: Hit the Emotional Gym - The Founder's Framework for Emotional Fitness
item.description: Information Source: [[First Round Review]] [[Emily Anhalt]] Tags: #mentalhealth #psychology #entrepreneurship Highlights Anhalt worked to dig deeper by conducting an interpretive phenomenological analysis of more than 100 interviews with psychologists and entrepreneurs to identify what exactly it is that makes a founder emotionally fit.

item.title: In Online Ed Content Is No Longer King - Cohorts Are - Essay
item.description: Information Source: [[Wes Kao]] Tags: #content #education Notes: [[Literature Notes/In Online Ed Content Is No Longer King - Cohorts Are - Literature Notes]] Highlights post-content age

item.description: Information Tags: #design Notes [[Miscellaneous Notes/Daily Notes/2020-09-15]]: Introduction to Information Architecture

item.description: Information Tags: #creativity #innovation Notes [[Miscellaneous Notes/Daily Notes/2020-11-10]]: Creativity as Human [[Miscellaneous Notes/Daily Notes/2020-12-18]]: Creativity as Revision [[Miscellaneous Notes/Daily Notes/2021-01-05]]: Creativity as Resistance

item.title: Is the Metaverse Finally Emerging - Essay
item.description: Information Source: [[Ray Schroeder]]; https://www.insidehighered.com/digital-learning/blogs/online-trending-now/metaverse-finally-emerging Tags: #metaverse #education Notes: Highlights Frey notes that there are technological challenges that must be overcome to facilitate growth.

item.title: Its time to build - A New Worlds Fair - Essay
item.description: Information Source: [[Cameron Wise]] Tags: #innovation Notes: Highlights While most have heard of the World’s Fairs, few know how important they were in shaping our culture.

item.title: Kernel Learn Track - Module 0
item.description: See [[Resource Notes/Kernel Learn Track - Resource Notes]] The Play of Pattern #cognition #personaldevelopment Goal: learn framework that will help you think in transformative ways about Web3 !

item.title: Kernel Learn Track - Module 1
item.description: See [[Resource Notes/Kernel Learn Track - Resource Notes]] Ethereum’s History and State #crypto #technology #philosophy [Bitcoin] represents an incredibly important moment in the movement towards money as a protocol, the development of new means to create or describe value, and new media by which we can relate that to and with one another in an agreeable fashion.

item.title: Kernel Learn Track - Module 2
item.description: The Global Financial System We hope that you can already appreciate a little bit more deeply how to make meaning from the raw material of your life; not necessarily through grandiose action, but rather as the result of joyful little subversions along the way of real awareness and humility.

item.title: Kernel Learn Track - Module 3
item.description: Take Back the Web Why did the initial visions for the world wide web not work out quite as their inventors intended?

item.title: Kernel Learn Track - Module 4
item.description: Internet Age Institutions Chesterton’s Fence story: don’t break down barriers the function of which you do not fully understand.

item.title: Kernel Learn Track - Resource Notes
item.description: Reference Source: [[Kernel]] Keywords: [[permanent notes] Notes [[Resource Notes/Kernel Learn Track - Module 0]] [[Resource Notes/Kernel Learn Track - Module 1]] [[Resource Notes/Kernel Learn Track - Module 2]] [[Resource Notes/Kernel Learn Track - Module 3]] [[Resource Notes/Kernel Learn Track - Module 4]]

item.title: Learning to earn vs learning to learn - Essay
item.description: Information Source: [[EdMuse]] Tags: #education #philosophy Notes: [[Literature Notes/Learning to earn vs. learning to learn - Literature Notes]] Highlights As part of his vision for democratic education, Dewey believed that education should do more beyond training students to fill a job.

item.title: LYT 10 - Bianca Pereira - Session 1
item.description: [[LYT 10 MOC]] Topic: Agile Notemaking #research Introduction Her definition of research: critical thinking + knowledge creation. [[Research consists of critical thinking and knowledge creation]] Anyone who uses critical thinking to create NEW knowledge Goal: PKM for research; how to turn ideas into outputs What this will not cover: How to do research LYT [[Permanent Notes/Idea Emergence]] !

item.title: LYT 10 - Bianca Pereira - Session 2
item.description: [[LYT 10 MOC]] Topic: Processing the Literature Why do we need sources? Provenance: from source to idea…tracing the path our ideas aren’t original Strengthens our arguments We use multiple documents to support an idea “We read 10 papers to write one sentence” Sea of Uncertainty: we are swimming in information all around us If you only have a few productive hours in a day…how do you use it?

item.title: LYT 10 - Sensemaking 1
item.description: [[LYT 10 MOC]] Encounter to Expression Walk around -> encounter -> spark -> develop insights further Practice + theory Do not go online Exercise Prompts This reminds me of… This is interesting to me… It’s important because… It’s good because… It’s bad because… [[Permanent Notes/ACE Thought-Weaving Framework]]

item.title: LYT 10 - Sensemaking 2
item.description: [[LYT 10 MOC]] The NoMA Method NoMa: note-making sharpens your thinking, gives you intellectual assets What most of us are not doing: externalizing our ideas…this is what we want to improve on Note-taking quickly captured other people’s thoughts FOMO mentality easy in, easy out Note-making mindfully made your words active JOMO mindfully in, mindfully out Note-making is the act of investing in yourself.

item.title: LYT 10 - Sensemaking 3
item.description: [[LYT 10 MOC]] Prioritize relevance over structure Takeaways Trust the process To build our custom PKM system sustainably, we have to go through the process of building it iteratively – over time – by using the principles of systems theory, where we allow the process of emergence to work for us.

item.title: LYT 10 - Sensemaking 4
item.description: [[LYT 10 MOC]] Progressive Ideation process (Highlights to Insights) Read the new note Create a new note and paste a highlight with a comment or two We connect that note to something else We develop that note by doing some note-making We likely create a statement note Try it on your own Read: [[Resource Notes/Evergreen notes turn ideas into objects that you can manipulate]] It’s not about the article; it’s more about the ==insights== you’ve gained from the article

item.title: LYT 10 - Super Session 1
item.description: [[LYT 10 MOC]] Topic: [[Permanent Notes/ACE Thought-Weaving Framework]] Feedback 1 Which prompts above resonated with you the most? Share your responses.

item.title: LYT 10 - Super Session 2
item.description: [[LYT 10 MOC]] [[LYT 10 MOC]] On Flow Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi Goal : get out of hamster wheel, gain sense of control over thinking A MOC is a way to get out of the hamster wheel !

item.title: LYT 10 - Super Session 3
item.description: [[LYT 10 MOC]] Map-making: Supercharge how you work with ideas Lifecycles Map This is [[Permanent Notes/Idea Emergence]], not “convergence” “Organizing is sensemaking” Connect your sensemaking system

item.title: LYT 10 - Super Session 4
item.description: [[LYT 10 MOC]] [[Permanent Notes/Idea Emergence]] ![[images/Pasted image 20230222010710.png]] Compounding 3 Elements of Sensemaking Connect Express 4 Patterns of Sensemaking Emergent How emergence happens: notes turn into constellations spark-driven; serendipitious Workflow suggestions The Daily Spark & The Weekly Arc First Light / Last Light Progressive an idea grows over time can be linear and non-linear Workflow suggestion: highlights to insights Tension-resolving Often being able to resurface ideas in context to ignite ideation.

item.title: Monomythical - Newsletter
item.description: Information Source: [[Nadia Eghbal]] Tags: #internet #creators Notes: [[Literature Notes/Monomythical - Literature Notes]] Highlights 24: Monasteries ==Knowledge work== regards us from high upon Maslow’s hierarchy over the crook of its bespectacled nose; it’s easy to miss right now, in light of more pressing basic needs (food, income, where to live, daily mood).

item.title: More to That - Blog
item.description: Information Source: [[Lawrence Yeo]] Tags: #philosophy #life #people #psychology #sociology Notes: [[Literature Notes/More to That - Literature Notes]] Highlights The Information Lifecycle: How Three Filters Shape the Mind Attention is a ==zero-sum game.

item.title: Neuroplasticity - How to Use Your Brain’s Malleability to Improve Your Well-being
item.description: Information Source: Accelerate Learning Community Tags: #mentalhealth #psychology Highlights What it is, and why it’s important Neuroplasticity, or the capacity for our brain cells to change in response to our behavior, can help us more thoughtfully engage in activities that will contribute to our well-being–no matter our age.

item.title: Non Obvious Megatrends - Book
item.description: Information Source: [[Rohit Bhargava]] Tags: #nonfiction #business #trends #strategy Notes: [[Literature Notes/Non Obvious Megatrends - Literature Notes]] Highlights You can’t understand the world better simply by reading about it as much as possible.

item.title: On Roblox Kids Learn Its Hard to Earn Money Making Games - Essay
item.description: Information Source: [[Cecilia D’ Anastasio]] Tags: #metaverse #games #creators #business Notes: Highlights How Roblox is Exploiting Young Game Developers

item.title: Ortographic Media - Article
item.description: Information Source: [[Robin Sloan]] Tags: #technology #social #media Notes: N/A Highlights [[Permanent Notes/context collapse]] is the standardization of all events to fit in one generic timeline.

item.title: Our Way Out - Close Collaboration Between Liberal and Vocational Education - Essay
item.description: Information Source: [[Mind Apivessa]] Tags: #education Notes: Highlights ==[[Permanent Notes/Liberal education]]==, manifested in the form of universities and colleges, exist as a space and time for students to expose themselves to a wide array of disciplines, prepare students for a continuously-changing democratic society, and learn from professors whose work isn’t driven by profit-maximization.

item.title: Resisting Distance Learning - Essay
item.description: Information Source: Tags: #education #technology #edtech Notes: Highlights [[Permanent Notes/Banking model of education]] Teaching and learning is not a simple matter of rote knowledge transmission—experts passing information to non-experts by whatever medium is available.

item.title: Rosieland - Newsletter
item.description: Information Source: [[Rosie Sherry]] Tags: #community Notes: [[Literature Notes/Rosieland - Literature Notes]]

item.title: SocSci 12 - Class
item.description: Information Tags: #sociology #culture Notes [[Miscellaneous Notes/Daily Notes/2020-09-15]]: Perspectives of Modernity lecture [[Miscellaneous Notes/Daily Notes/2020-09-16]]: Modernity Reading takeaways

item.title: The case study factory - Essay
item.description: Information Source: UXDesign.cc Tags: #design #education Notes: Highlights Bootcamps skip on foundational disciplines due to lack of time.

item.title: The Dirty Little Secrets About The Worst Coding Bootcamps Out There - Essay
item.description: Information Source: Tags: #education #technology Notes: Highlights Similar to [[Resource Notes/The case study factory - Essay]], on foundational disciplines of design

item.title: The Global Classroom - An Opportunity for Empowerment or Exploitation? - Publication
item.description: Information Source: [[William Pelech]] & [[Sharon Pelech]] Tags: #education #technology Notes: [[Literature Notes/The Global Classroom - An Opportunity for Empowerment or Exploitation - Literature Notes]] Highlights Similar thesis as [[Creation/Fast Food Education]]?

item.title: The Internet As Your Resume - Essay
item.description: Information Source: [[Rushil]]; https://www.rushil2cents.com/the-internet-as-your-resume/ Tags: #education #internet #web3 Notes: Highlights Graduating from a university means that you spent X amounts of money––to solve Y number of problems––for 1 credential.

item.title: The McDonaldization of Education - the rise of slow - Essay
item.description: Information Source: [[Shelley Wright]] Tags: #education #sociology #culture #business #philosophy Notes: [[Literature Notes/The McDonaldization of Education - the rise of slow - Literature Notes]] Highlights However, the thing that stands out most vividly is what Canadian journalist Carl Honore describes as ==“the cult of speed”.

item.title: The Minecraft Generation - Essay
item.description: Information Source: [[Clive Thompson]] Tags: #games #education Notes: Highlights For one thing, it doesn’t really feel like a game.

item.title: The Rise and Fall of Internet Art Communities - Essay
item.description: Information Source: [[Kelsey Ables]] Tags: Notes: Highlights Before big tech shepherded the vast number of online users onto a handful of sleek websites, there was a scrappier internet—where offbeat chat rooms and eccentric niche websites reigned, and carefully crafted “away statuses” were a kind of personal branding—back when you could be away from the internet.

item.title: The Sociology of Business - Newsletter
item.description: Information Source: [[Anna Andjelic]] Tags: #brand #strategy #business #culture #sociology Notes: [[Literature Notes/The Sociology of Business - Literature Notes]] Highlights Outsider Innovation ==Brand mood== is its aesthetic universe, ideas, values, beliefs, music, the energy of people and places, the crowd it gathers and the crowd that gathers around it.

item.title: The Workshopper Playbook - Book
item.description: Information Source: [[Jonatahan Courtney]] Tags: #design #workshop Notes: Highlights Recurring Problems: Teams didn’t know how to best start projects No clear, unified system in place for the actual running of a project Poor communication during the prohect stifled creativity and progress Root Cause:

item.title: This is Marketing - Book
item.description: Information Source: [[Seth Godin]] Tags: #nonfiction #marketing #business Notes: [[Literature Notes/This is Marketing - Literature Notes]] Highlights The first step on the path to make things better is to make better things.

item.title: This is Water - Speech
item.description: Information Source: [[David Foster Wallace]] Tags: #advice #life Notes: [[Literature Notes/This is Water - Literature Notes]] Highlights everything in my own immediate experience supports my deep belief that I am the absolute centre of the universe; the realest, most vivid and important person in existence.

item.title: Trick Mirror - Book
item.description: #unfinished Information Source: [[Jia Tolentino]] Tags: #nonfiction #essays Notes: [[Trick Mirror (Literature Notes)]] Highlights As more people began to register their existence digitally, a pastime turned into an imperative: you had to register yourself digitally to exist.

item.title: Udacitys Sebastian Thrun Godfather Of Free Online Education Changes - Essay
item.description: Information Source: Tags: #education Notes: Highlights It will be, Thrun admits, “the biggest shift in the history of the company,” a pivot that involves charging money for classes and abandoning academic disciplines in favor of more vocational-focused learning.

item.title: Uncanny Valley - Book
item.description: Information Source: [[Anna Wiener]] Tags: #nonfiction #memoir #technology #SiliconValley Notes: [[Literature Notes/Uncanny Valley - Literature Notes]] Highlights Expansion: that was the endgame.

item.title: Video Games are the Future of Education - Essay
item.description: Information Source: [[Nabeel Querehesi]]; https://nabeelqu.co/education Tags: #games #education #learning #innovation Notes: Highlights 1. The things you learn by yourself stick; the things that are “taught” to you do not stick.

item.title: Wellness Wisdom - Newsletter
item.description: Information Source: [[Patricia Mou]] Tags: #wellness #mentalhealth #personaldevelopment #spirituality #philosophy Notes: [[Literature Notes/Wellness Wisdom - Literature Notes]] Highlights Vol.

item.title: Why the Metaverse Matters - Essay
item.description: Information Source: [[Philip Wang]]; https://www.gather.town/post/why-the-metaverse-matters Tags: #metaverse Notes: Highlights What is the Metaverse and why does it matter? it will create ==meaningful human connection== and ==unprecedented access to opportunity,== no matter where you are.
